author: Sangeetha Kandavel
text:
The Tamil Nadu government has been given two weeks to come out with a competitive package to revive the Nokia manufacturing plant at Sriperumbudur, near Chennai.

On Thursday, officials from Tamil Nadu government had a meeting with the Fast Track Task Force set up by the Department of Electronics and Information Technology (DeitY). All stakeholders, including members of Department of Commerce and Revenue department, were present at the meeting.

“The ball is now in Tamil Nadu’s court. States like Andhra Pradesh and Telangana are offering competitive deals, so Tamil Nadu needs to go the extra mile and come out with a more competitive package,” said a senior official from the Fast Track Task Force.

“There are firms which are willing to come and manufacture at the facility. But it all depends on what package is being offered to them,” he added.

In 2015, Prime Minister Narendra Modi indicated that the government was making every effort to revive the plant. At that time, Ministers and officials from the Tamil Nadu government gave an assurance that they would not abandon the plant.

Nokia got the green signal to set up a Special Economic Zone in 2005 and was allocated 210.8 acres. The plant was set up in 2006 and was one of the largest facilities for the firm.
title: Nokia: State given two weeks to submit revival package
